body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.textVersion: 零一五四八 sān líng yī wǔ sì bā

body.quiz: A six-digit safe code is given in the audio. Which of the following digits is not in the code?
body.correct: Terrific job catching the digits one by one. Now you can open the safe!
body.incorrect: Very close. Try again. Please pay attention and try to catch each digit one by one.

body.quiz: Which one of the following is the number in the audio equal to?
body.correct: You are right. It’s number 二 èr (two)! Did you notice its unique pronunciation? We’ll learn this final “er” later in this course.
body.incorrect: Oops…you almost got it. Would you like to listen again? Please check earlier on this page for more clues.

body.quiz: Which of the following does the number in the audio best describe?
body.correct: Excellent! Yes, it’s number 七 qī (seven), and it best describes the days of the week.
body.incorrect: Very close! Listen to the audio again to understand which number it refers to, then consider which of the choices you can use it to descibe.

body.quiz: Which of the following descriptions does the number in the audio best fit?
body.answer: The number of sides a snowflake has
options: The number of planets in our solar system
The number of continents on Earth
The number of players on a basketball team
body.correct: You got it! Snowflakes always have six sides. Isn’t nature amazing?
body.incorrect: Very close. Try again. Please pay close attention to the initial.

body.quiz: Which of the following numbers does not have the same symbol (lucky/unlucky) as the number in the audio?
body.correct: Job well done! Number 八 bā (eight) is considered a lucky number because it has a similar pronunciation as 发 fā, which means prosperity. Numbers 6, 9, 10 all symbolize good luck in Chinese. Did you know that people in China would fight for a license plate that has many eights on it?
body.incorrect: So close… would you like to listen again and pay special attention to the initial?
